com.wizzer.mle.math

Class MlTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wizzer.mle.math.MlTransform

  • public class MlTransform
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a 4x3 affine matrix of floating-point elements.
    Author:
    Mark S. Millard

    • Field Summary

        Parameters:
        a11 - Element for row 0, column 0.
        a12 - Element for row 0, column 1.
        a13 - Element for row 0, column 2.
        a21 - Element for row 1, column 0.
        a22 - Element for row 1, column 1.
        a23 - Element for row 1, column 2.
        a31 - Element for row 2, column 0.
        a32 - Element for row 2, column 1.
        a33 - Element for row 2, column 2.
        a41 - Element for row 3, column 0.
        a42 - Element for row 3, column 1.
        a43 - Element for row 3, column 2.

      • factor

        public final boolean factor(MlTransform r,
                            MlVector3 s,
                            MlTransform u,
                            MlVector3 t,
                            MlTransform proj)
        Factors a matrix m into 5 pieces: m = r s r^ u t, where r^ means transpose of r, and r and u are rotations, s is a scale, and t is a translation. Any projection information is returned in proj.
        Parameters:
        r - The rotation of the transform.
        s - The scale of the transform.
        u - The rotation of the transform.
        t - The translation of the transform.
        proj - The projection of the transform.
        Returns:
        true is returned if this transform was successfully factored. Otherwise false will be returned upon failure.

      • inverse

        public final MlTransform inverse()
        This method finds the inverse of an affine matrix. The last column MUST be [0 0 0 1] for this to work. This is taken from graphics gems 2, page 603

        computes the inverse of a 3d affine matrix; i.e. a matrix with a dimensionality of 4 where the right column has the entries (0,0,0,1).

        This procedure treats the 4 by 4 matrix as a block matrix and calculates the inverse of one submatrix for a significant performance improvement over a general procedure that can invert any nonsingular matrix. 

                       -1 
    -1   |    |      |  -1    |
   M   = |A  0|  =   | A     0|
         |    |      |        |
         |    |      |   -1   |
         |C  1|      |-CA    1|
 
 where   M is a 4 by 4 matrix,
         A is the 3 by 3 upper left submatrix of M,
         C is the 1 by 3 lower left submatrix of M.
        Returns:
        A new transform is returned. It will be the inverse matrix of this one if-and-only-if this one is nonsingular and affine. Otherwise, the returned transform will be unchanged.

      • transpose

        public final MlTransform transpose()
        Calculate the transpose of the matrix.
        Returns:
        Returns transpose of matrix as a new transform.

        public final MlTransform mulRight(MlTransform trans)

      • mulDirMatrix

        public final void mulDirMatrix(MlVector3 src,
                               MlVector3 dst)
        Multiplies given row vector by matrix, giving vector result. src is assumed to be a direction vector, so translation part of matrix is ignored.
        Parameters:
        src - The source vector to multiply this transform with.
        dst - The result of the multiplication.

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(MlTransform trans,
                            float tolerance)
        Equality comparison within given tolerance, for each component.
        Parameters:
        trans - The matrix to compare against this one.
        tolerance - The tolerance in each component to determine if equality can be reached.
        Returns:
        true will be returned if this transform is equal to trans. Otherwise, false will be returned.

      • getTransform

        public final void getTransform(MlVector3 translation,
                               MlRotation rotation,
                               MlVector3 scaleFactor,
                               MlRotation scaleOrientation,
                               MlVector3 center)
        Decomposes the matrix into a translation, rotation, scale, and scale orientation. Any projection information is discarded. The decomposition depends upon choice of center point for rotation and scaling, which is optional as the last parameter. Note that if the center is 0, decompose() is the same as factor() where "t" is translation, "u" is rotation, "s" is scaleFactor, and "r" is ScaleOrientattion.
        Parameters:
        translation - The translation component of the transform.
        rotation - The rotation component of the transform.
        scaleFactor - The scale component of the transform.
        scaleOrientation - The scale orientation component of the transform.
        center - The center point to use for determining rotation and scaling.

      • getTransform

        public final void getTransform(MlVector3 translation,
                               MlRotation rotation,
                               MlVector3 scale,
                               MlRotation scaleOrientation)
        Decomposes the matrix into a translation, rotation, scale, and scale orientation. Any projection information is discarded. The center point is assumed to be (0,0,0).
        Parameters:
        translation - The translation component of the transform.
        rotation - The rotation component of the transform.
        scale - The scale component of the transform.
        scaleOrientation - The scale orientation component of the transform.

      • setTransform

        public final void setTransform(MlVector3 translation,
                               MlVector3 rotation,
                               MlVector3 scale)
        Sets the given transform to the matrix constructed from the given translation, fixed rotation, and scale vectors. Note: Uses scale - rotate - translate order with rotation order Z-Y-X.
        Parameters:
        translation - The translation component to set.
        rotation - The rotation component to set.
        scale - The scale component to set.

      • setTransform

        public final void setTransform(MlVector3 translation,
                               MlVector3 rotation,
                               MlVector3 nonuniformScale,
                               float scale)
        Sets the given transform to the matrix constructed from the given translation, fixed angle rotation, and nonuniformScale*scale vectors. Note: Uses scale - rotate - translate order with rotation order Z-Y-X.
        Parameters:
        translation - The translation component to set.
        rotation - The rotation component to set.
        nonuniformScale - The non-uniform scaling component to set..
        scale - The scale component to set.

        scaleFactor - The scale component of the transform.
        scaleOrientation - The scale orientation component of the transform.
        center - The center point to use for determining rotation and scaling.

      • setTransform

        public final void setTransform(MlVector3 translation,
                               MlRotation rotation,
                               MlVector3 scale)
        Composes the matrix from the specified translation, rotation, and scale. Assumes scaleOrientation is (0,0,0,1) and center point is (0,0,0).
        Parameters:
        translation - The translation component of the transform.
        rotation - The rotation component of the transform.
        scale - The scale component of the transform.

        rotation - The rotation component of the transform.
        scale - The scale component of the transform.
